name: places/ChIJwz3PA_NZwokRPj6-eZIAc5Q
formattedAddress: 525 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 525 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Vintage-style quarters in a trendy boutique hotel with a gym, an Italian restaurant & a rooftop bar.

originalText.text: Wow! I’m shocked they are considered a 4.5 star hotel! No way would I rate them that high.  First, the bed is terrible!!  You can hear and feel the metal springs and very uncomfortable. You can see in my pic where the bedspread is showing how lumpy the bed is.  The air conditioner won’t stop no matter what I do.  Even in the off position. The room is shabby at best.  I will not come back.

text.text: Wow! I’m shocked they are considered a 4.5 star hotel! No way would I rate them that high.  First, the bed is terrible!!  You can hear and feel the metal springs and very uncomfortable. You can see in my pic where the bedspread is showing how lumpy the bed is.  The air conditioner won’t stop no matter what I do.  Even in the off position. The room is shabby at best.  I will not come back.

originalText.text: Just checked in for the weekend. The lobby and rooftop bar are small but well appointed. The rooms are decent size and clean but there was lots of deferred maintenance, peeling paint, decayed caulking, dirty walls, sink won’t drain. The hotel is a bit older and it’s showing. Somewhat typical of NYC but I would pay a bit more to stay someplace else. Also the resort/amenity fee provides little value aside from a bottle of water which is disappointing.

text.text: Just checked in for the weekend. The lobby and rooftop bar are small but well appointed. The rooms are decent size and clean but there was lots of deferred maintenance, peeling paint, decayed caulking, dirty walls, sink won’t drain. The hotel is a bit older and it’s showing. Somewhat typical of NYC but I would pay a bit more to stay someplace else. Also the resort/amenity fee provides little value aside from a bottle of water which is disappointing.

originalText.text:
Had actually stayed at this hotel in July and overall, a great experience. The rooms are fairly clean and housekeeping did a great job in ensuring that everything was up to par during our five day stay.
The front desk staff were helpful enough to split the hold for us when we were having unfortunate card/bank issues. Should be aware though that because it is an older building, there were issues with the shower (we couldn't quite figure out how to turn on/off the shower) and for some reason room service was not always available via the room phone.
There would also be a long wait for the elevator as it seemed that the rooftop bar was prioritized by the hotel.
Other than those few things, the hotel was lovely to stay at. The whole vibe and aesthetic present was good. Overall if you'd like to come into New York, stay neat SOHO, and be in an quieter area compared to Times Square, this is the place.

originalText.text: The staff was amazing. Very polite and very helpful. It was an absolutely clean place. The restaurant had delicious food. The rooftop was absolutely lovely to sit on at night and overlook the Hudson River. The only thing is I wish they had a complimentary breakfast in the morning, but all that being said, everything was so great at the HugoI would come back absolutely!

originalText.text: A wonderful  little gem in Soho. Room prices are very reasonable.  The staff very nice and friendly.  Highly recommend  it.

text.text: A wonderful  little gem in Soho. Room prices are very reasonable.  The staff very nice and friendly.  Highly recommend  it.
